titles.title: To amend title 49, United States Code, to require air carriers to remove from a passenger aircraft any baggage that is checked by a passenger who does not board the aircraft, and for other purposes.

action.text: Referred to the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure.
Referred to the Subcommittee on Aviation.

committee.name: House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure

bill.summary: 10/31/2001--Introduced. Amends Federal aviation law to require air carriers to remove from a passenger aircraft any baggage that is checked by a passenger who does not check-in at the appropriate airport gate and board the aircraft. Requires the Secretary of Transportation to report to Congress with respect to a program to provide for the screening of all property (including checked baggage) taken on board a passenger aircraft.
